posts.author: feuderali
posts.content:
Hi I've been trying to come up with an optimized level 40 build for a Dwarf battle/war cleric.  You'd think there'd be a ton of options however I can't find one that suits my needs.  They're mostly just taking a few (upto 15) cleric levels to get some self buffing then focussing on being melee.  I'd like one that has respectable divine spell casting, so mainly cleric levels with melee to support.  Other than cleric I don't care too much which classes get mixed in however I don't want RDD for this character and he must be good or neutral alignment so sadly BG is out (although a good option for this build). I also want to use warhammers so not a flurry of blows kama build.
This character will be levelled normally.  Being mainly cleric this shouldn't present a problem however it does mean I need to try and avoid the 20% xp penalty which unfortunately means cleric/paladin isn't an option really although it would fit well.

1) PvM or PvP - PvM mainly although PvP is enabled on the server so should be a consideration. Definitely not a duelling build however.
2) Level cap - 40
3) Race preference - Must be a Dwarf.
4) Class preference - As above, Cleric main + whatever.  Archetype: Dwarven Holy Warrior, Champion of Moradin/Clangeddin, War Priest.
5) Melee preference - 1h and shield, warhammer, heavy plate.
6) Range preference - Maybe a crossbow just for the utility, I don't want to waste feats investing in ranged though. I guess zen archery would be a great 1 feat investment for this guy tho so maybe.
7) Weapon preference - Warhammer
8) Maximum item enhancement - I'm not sure on the max but relatively low to medium magic so GMW, darkfire etc very useful.
9) Spellcasting - As much cleric as I can fit in without gimping the melee side.  Mainly melee fighting with spells to buff, provide utility and as a supplementary offence. If possible I'd like to fit in a SF and GSF, and one arcane defence. However they're not game breaking. 
10) Custom factors - I can adapt if there are.

Thanks guys!

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
If you want a strong spellcaster then having at least 24-26 levels in the class is mandatory. Dwarfs favour fighters a lot, so 4-6 levels will give you a good boost in your damage and you can round-up the build with 10 levels of CoT without occurring an exp penalty at all. Then, ESF in evocation can be fit inside the build without a problem and although you won't have the best DC's for your spells (due to focus in strength) at least they can be decent that way.

I don't have the time for a full build right now, but I will give you the fundamentals of the build and you tell me if you like it.

Str16(28) Dex(8) Con(16) Int(14) Wis15(20) Cha(6) makes a nice starting point for a Cleric(26)/ Fighter(4)/ Champion of Torm(10)
The build is Cleric(12)/ Fighter(4)/ Champion of Torm(4) (pre-epic) 

Weapon focus, Improved Critical, Weapon Specialization, Blind-Fight, Knockdown, Improved Knockdown, Spell Focus, Greater Spell Focus, Extend Spell, Empower Spell, Maximize Spell, Toughness (pre-epic)
Epic Weapon Focus, Epic Weapon Specialization, Epic Prowess, Armour Skin, Epic Spell Focus, Great Strength V, Great Wisdom II (epic)

Your AB should be +40/ +35/ +30/ +25 with 4 attacks/round &
Your DMG should be 1d8+15/ 19-20x3 with a stock warhammer

Pretty respectable figures I would say, even before you think about buffing yourself...

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
When I envisioned this build I had in mind a couple of things,
a) you should end up with even scores in both wisdom & strength pre-epic (18Str/ 18Wis)
b) you should take ewf, ews, ep as CoT bonus feats & armour skin, esf as Cleric bonus feats in epic
c) all other great attribute feats should be taken with your epic general feats (exactly seven)
d) maximize spell could be exchanged with expertise should you want it to, do not spend an epic feat for that
e) you have an unused epic general feat at 21st level (these feats, all of them should be great attribute feats)
f) there is no need to delay your fighter levels too much, get your combat feats fast and then you can focus on your caster ones 

Personally, I would not take these abjuration gimmicks of the server and instead focus on what you had in mind originally (evocation)
Finally, yes, 26 CL is good enough (undispellable except mords), in fact, 26 CL was always the gold standard with Cleric builds.

Hope I helped a bit, I will have another look at your (improved) build later as well.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
This build has a buffed AB of 66 which is monstrous in Low-to-Medium magic worlds. Moreover, he can achieve 90-95% of that with self-buffs (domain powers not included) which makes him extremely reliable in any situation. I like your fixed version feuderali, it should do well in any module/PW. Your levelling/feat order could be improved somewhat but even like that it is fine.

For playability's sake, for example, I would take the two increases in strength first and then follow with the three wisdom increases (pre-epic). I would put "toughness" at 18th level and get the combat feats first and I would start with Fighter instead of Cleric so I can start with 5AB instead of 3AB. In epic levels I would take that 23rd Cleric level first, then start with CoT for example so I could get armour skin earlier and a CL increase or I would stop it at 20 then take all CoT levels asap to get my epic combat feats earlier and then continue with Cleric.

This stuff is nitpicking though and I feel you have done a good job overall with this build, you only need a good hammer (of thunderbolts) now and you are ready to go!

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
If you are referring to permadeath worlds and so on then you are probably right feuderali, but even on WoG (which is a hard PW), you can start with a bunch of healing potions which is why I figured a strong starting AB was preferable.

About the final maximum AB this is always calculated as (Base AB +20 AB max from various bonuses +6 AB from max strength) and then there are the de-buffs (curse song, prayer, taunt etc) and the "feats" which is mainly the "smite" ability. If you see anything else on your character sheet then ignore it, it isn't very accurate, the combat log is much better. The character sheet also does not take into account stuff like size modifiers (Dragonshape AB, AC) and so on.

Finally, the feat choice is entirely up to you and all you have said would be a good choice, however, I have seen some very good results by using "scribe scroll" or "craft wand". It is very handy to have 100 Heal scrolls ready in your scroll case, or a wand with 50 charges of Darkfire ready to use and since I see that you want to have as much magical power as possible, then I feel one of these feats would be a good alternative to (Zen archery, Expertise).

About the AB, yes I'm just going by the character sheet once fully buffed. I'm not taking debuffs into account.
